english: to display; to state; old/aged; surname

etymology.description: semantic 阜 “mound” + phonetic 東 (→ 东).
etymology.interpretation: Left 阝 (from 阜) suggests ranks/arrangement along a mound or slope, aligning with meanings like “to display/arrange.” The phonetic 東 (simplified to 东) supplies the pronunciation, which remains after simplification while the semantic left side is preserved.
etymology.simplification: Replaced the phonetic 東 with its simplified form 东 to reduce strokes while keeping the semantic 阝 (from 阜) unchanged.

examples.chinese: 他在展厅陈列了古董(他在展廳陳列了古董)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài zhǎntīng chénliè le gǔdǒng.
examples.english: He displayed antiques in the exhibition hall.

examples.chinese: 律师在法庭上陈述事实(律師在法庭上陳述事實)。
examples.pinyin: Lǜshī zài fǎtíng shàng chénshù shìshí.
examples.english: The lawyer stated the facts in court.

examples.chinese: 陈先生收藏了许多陈年好酒(陳先生收藏了許多陳年好酒)。
examples.pinyin: Chén xiānsheng shōucáng le xǔduō chénnián hǎojiǔ.
examples.english: Mr. Chen has collected many well-aged wines.
